root.name: addRow()
root.description: Use addRow() to add a new row of data to a Table object. By default, an empty row is created. Typically, you would store a reference to the new row in a TableRow object (see newRow in the example above), and then set individual values using setInt(), setFloat(), or setString(). If a TableRow object is included as a parameter, then that row is duplicated and added to the table.
